item.title: 中国出口下降打击经济反弹希望
item.description: 中国 3 月份出口下降，打击了全球需求将继续帮助推动世界第二大经济体增长的希望。【原文：China’s exports fell in March, dealing a blow to hopes that global demand would continue to help drive growth in the world’s second-largest economy.】

item.title: 哈萨克斯坦结束最长宽松周期，关注价格压力
item.description: 哈萨克斯坦停止了近十年来持续时间最长的一系列降息措施，在央行估量国内和邻国俄罗斯的物价压力之际，维持了借贷成本。【原文：Kazakhstan halted its longest series of interest-rate cuts in nearly a decade, holding the cost of borrowing as the central bank gauges price pressures at home and in neighboring Russia.】

item.title: 美国限制航班频率，中国航空公司业绩下滑
item.description: 周五，中国最大的航空公司股价暴跌，因为投资者对美国航空公司试图阻止世界上最大的两个经济体之间增加航班频率的消息作出了反应。【原文：Shares of China’s biggest airlines slumped on Friday as investors reacted to news that US carriers are trying to block any increase in flight frequencies between the world’s two biggest economies.】

item.title: 1987 年式崩溃风险促使鲁弗尔创纪录地押注现金
item.description: 随着美国流动性的萎缩，市场发生剧烈逆转的可能性增大，Ruffer LLP 将其有史以来最大的赌注押在了现金上。【原文：Ruffer LLP is making its biggest-ever bet on cash as shrinking US liquidity boosts the possibility of a violent market reversal.】

item.title: 英国称汽车贷款公司应为调查带来的财务影响做好准备
item.description: 英国金融行为监管局（Financial Conduct Authority）警告汽车金融公司开始为其汽车金融产品审查可能产生的额外成本做好准备，因为近几个月来，贷款机构在是否立即对盈利造成打击的问题上意见不一。【原文：The Financial Conduct Authority warned motor finance firms to begin preparing for additional costs that may arise from its review of car finance products after lenders in recent months diverged on whether to take an immediate hit to earnings.】

item.title: StanChart 任命中国区首席执行官张杰瑞为金融投资部联席主管
item.description: 渣打银行中国区首席执行官张杰瑞将担任金融机构业务全球联席主管的新职务，这是渣打银行新成立的企业与投资银行内部更广泛改组的一部分。【原文：Standard Chartered Plc’s China Chief Executive Officer Jerry Zhang will take on a new role as global co-head of financial institutions coverage, as part of a broader reshuffle within the bank’s new corporate and investment bank.】

item.title: 日本央行押注，日本五年期收益率升至 2011 年以来最高点
item.description: 日本五年期国债收益率攀升至 2011 年以来的最高点，原因是越来越多的人猜测日本央行将提高利率以遏制日元疲软。【原文：Japan’s five-year bond yield climbed to the highest since 2011 on growing speculation the nation’s central bank will raise interest rates to stem weakness in the yen.】

item.title: 据说 MUFG 正在讨论以 17 亿美元收购 HDFC 部门的股份
item.description: 据知情人士透露，三菱日联金融集团公司（Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group Inc.【原文：Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group Inc. is in talks to acquire a roughly $1.7 billion stake in HDFC Bank Ltd.’s consumer lending unit to tap booming demand for personal finance loans in India, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 斯托纳拉斯：欧洲央行是时候与美联储背道而驰了
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员亚尼斯-斯托纳拉斯（Yannis Stournaras）认为，欧洲中央银行不应害怕改变其 "过于谨慎 "的利率立场，而不是像美联储那样。【原文：The European Central Bank shouldn’t be afraid to shift its “overly prudent” stance on interest rates away from that of the Federal Reserve, according to Governing Council member Yannis Stournaras.】

item.title: 中国银行称开发商贷款出现问题不会怪罪员工
item.description: 为了响应政府的号召，支持陷入困境的房地产市场，中国多家国有银行正在做出最大努力，鼓励信贷人员为开发商审批贷款。【原文：A number of Chinese state banks are making their strongest effort yet to encourage credit officers to approve loans for developers, in a bid to heed the government’s call to prop up the embattled real estate market.】

item.title: 英国经济 2 月份连续第二个月增长
item.description: 2016 年 5 月 13 日星期五，一名佩戴英国国旗徽章的员工在英国伦敦的 Brompton 自行车有限公司工厂内为一辆 Brompton 折叠自行车焊接拉伸管。Brompton 由剑桥大学毕业的工程师安德鲁-里奇（Andrew Ritchie）于 1975 年创造。摄影师：西蒙-道森【原文：An employee wearing British Union flag badge welds a tension tube for a Brompton folding bicycle inside the Brompton Bicycle Ltd. factory in London, U.K., on Friday, May 13, 2016. The Brompton was created in 1975 by Andrew Ritchie, a Cambridge-trained engineer. Photographer: Simon Dawson】

item.title: 欧洲央行卡扎克斯称有望在 6 月降息
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员马丁斯-卡扎克（Martins Kazaks）表示，欧洲中央银行有望在 6 月份开始降低借贷成本。【原文：The European Central Bank is on track to start lowering borrowing costs in June, according to Governing Council member Martins Kazaks.】

item.title: 陷入困境的美联储降息押注甚至抹平了去年的债券涨幅
item.description: 寄希望于延续去年全球债券涨势的投资者受到了残酷的现实检验。【原文：Investors wagering on an extension of last year’s global bond gains have been served a harsh reality check.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事欧洲
item.description:
及时了解市场监测情况

 

Get up to speed with what the markets are monitoring

 

】

item.title: 拉加德宣布独立于美联储
item.description:
随着大西洋两岸疫情过后的经济出现分化，欧洲央行将在 6 月份降息。【原文：

Pencil in an ECB rate cut for June as the post-pandemic economies on both sides of the Atlantic diverge.

】

item.title: 日本央行历史性举措推高日本企业短期成本
item.description: 随着日本央行准备逐步减少企业债券购买量，许多日本公司正以更高的价格从短期票据中筹集资金，这也是日本央行摆脱超宽松政策的历史性举措之一。【原文：Many Japanese companies are paying more to raise money from shorter-tenor notes as the Bank of Japan prepares to wind down corporate bond purchases as part of its historic move away from ultra-accommodative policy.】

item.title: 如何在资本主义体系内实现零净排放
item.description:
在本期《Merryn Talks Money》节目中，我们将讨论企业和政府如何携手应对全球变暖。【原文：

On this episode of Merryn Talks Money, we discuss how business and government can work together to fight global warming.

】

item.title: 欧洲对冲基金模仿者的黄金时代可能已经结束
item.description: 2017 年，尤塔罗-卢比奥（Yutaro Rubio）来到巴黎的一次会议现场，看到陌生面孔时感到非常惊讶。当时，他追踪另类UCITS已经有十年之久，通常情况下，他几乎认识所有花时间参加这些活动的人。【原文：Arriving at a conference in Paris in 2017, Yutaro Rubio was surprised to see unfamiliar faces. He’d tracked alternative UCITS for a decade at that point, and usually he’d know pretty much everyone who took the time to attend these events.】

item.title: 拜登超越特朗普将中国实体列入黑名单的记录
item.description: 乔-拜登总统将更多的中国公司和个人列入出口黑名单，其数量超过了任何一届美国政府，因为世界最大经济体之间日益加剧的摩擦继续使全球贸易复杂化。【原文：President Joe Biden has added more Chinese companies and individuals to an export blacklist than any US administration, as growing frictions between the world’s biggest economies continue to complicate global trade.】

item.title: 波兰的转变显示了匈牙利落后时民粹主义的代价
item.description: 波兰重新成为欧盟的主流，使其成为一些投资者眼中的年度转机。【原文：Poland’s re-embrace of the European Union mainstream is making it the turnaround story of the year for some investors.】

item.title: 巴西国家石油公司董事长被停职，导致领导权争论复杂化
item.description: 巴西石油公司（Petroleo Brasileiro SA）政府任命的主席因涉嫌利益冲突而被法院停职，这是该公司数周来领导层斗争的一个新转折。【原文：A court suspended Petroleo Brasileiro SA’s government-appointed chairman for alleged conflicts of interest, a new twist in a leadership struggle that has consumed the company for weeks.】

item.title: 三井不动产实施 ROE 计划，日本地产股大涨
item.description: 日本房地产巨头三井不动产公司（Mitsui Fudosan Co.【原文：Japanese real estate giant Mitsui Fudosan Co. surged, leading its peers higher after announcing business plans that included a buyback, a return-on-equity target and payout ratio.】

item.title: 摩根大通私人银行任命高盛夔为中国市场主管
item.description: 摩根大通（JPMorgan Chase & Co.【原文：JPMorgan Chase & Co. named Florence Kui as head of China market for its private bank, amid broader changes to its overall leadership overseeing operations in the world’s second largest economy.】

item.title: 中东紧张局势刺激避险需求，黄金再创新高
item.description: 由于以色列准备应对伊朗或其代理人的袭击，交易员们也在思考最新的美国经济数据，黄金触及了新的纪录。【原文：Gold touched a fresh record as Israel prepared for a strike by Iran or its proxies, and traders mulled the latest US economic data.】

item.title: 中国前景改善，铁矿石有望每周大涨 10
item.description: 铁矿石周涨幅达到约 10%，原因是市场猜测中国经济可能正在好转，从而提振了需求前景。【原文：Iron ore headed for a weekly gain of about 10% on speculation that China’s economy may be on the mend, buoying the outlook for demand.】

item.title: 据称布鲁克菲尔德公司正在洽谈收购卡斯尔莱克公司的多数股权
item.description: 据知情人士透露，布鲁克菲尔德资产管理公司（Brookfield Asset Management）正在就收购私人信贷管理公司 Castlelake 的多数股权进行深入谈判。【原文：Brookfield Asset Management is in advanced talks to buy a majority stake in private-credit manager Castlelake, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 外汇衍生品惨败使印度监管风险成为焦点
item.description: 在散户投资者和自营交易商的推动下，交易所交易的货币衍生品在印度蓬勃发展了十多年。后来，中央银行打破了这一局面。【原文：Exchange-traded currency derivatives thrived in India for over a decade, fueled by retail investors and proprietary traders. Then the central bank broke up the party.】

item.title: 危机？什么危机？巴西国家石油公司总裁展望未来
item.description: 巴西国家石油公司（Petrobras）首席执行官让-保罗-普拉茨（Jean Paul Prates）在数周后的首次公开露面中强调了勘探机会，此前外界一直猜测他将失去巴西国有石油公司负责人的职位。【原文：Petrobras Chief Executive Officer Jean Paul Prates highlighted exploration opportunities in his first public appearance after weeks of speculation that he would lose his job as the head of Brazil’s state-controlled oil company.】

item.title: 民意调查后，韩国央行维持利率不变，选择稳健立场
item.description: 韩国央行维持基准利率不变，这一决定凸显了韩国央行在执政党选举受挫后稳定控制通胀压力的目标。【原文：The Bank of Korea kept its benchmark interest rate on hold in a decision underscoring its aim to rein in inflationary pressure in a steady manner after an election setback for the ruling party.】

item.title: 安全测试公司 UL Solutions 扩大首次公开募股规模，募集资金 9.46 亿美元
item.description: UL Solutions 公司首次公开发行股票募集了 9.46 亿美元，这家安全测试和检验公司扩大了发行规模，并将股票定价控制在市场范围内。【原文：UL Solutions Inc.’s initial public offering raised $946 million as the safety testing and inspection company expanded the size of the offering and priced the shares within a marketed range.】
